The officers of the Veracruz and San Juan de Ulúa's fort garrisons gathered in the house of Colonel Pedro Landero, in which they agreed to support The 1824 Federal Constitution of The United Mexican States, the demotion of all ministers implemented during the centralist regime, and that Antonio López de Santa Anna will be the one that oversees negotiations with Vicepresident Bustamante and other authorities. Santa Anna was the true hidden organizer of the Plan, and after rebels captured a convoy with munitions, money and supplies, the revolt began, but it was not until recently that the garrisons of Toluca, Tejupilco, Puebla, Guanajuato, Querétaro, Michoacán, Tlaxcala, Jalisco, Acapulco, Oaxaca and Aguascalientes have joined the rebellion in which has turned into a full-blown civil war.

The Zavaleta Conventions were meetings in which Antonio López de Santa Anna, Anastasio Bustamante and Manuel Gómez Pedraza signed up an agreement in Puebla, with this treaty, Manuel Gómez Pedraza assumed the Presidency of Mexico and by this, the constitutional order went back to normal, this also meant that the republican and federal system returned, as well as general amnisty for the events that took place on September 1st, 1828..

After Santa Anna was proclaimed as 'Protector of the Catholic Religion' by the clergy on May 16th, and 'Sustainer of the Religion and the Patriotic Liberties' on May 23rd, on May 25th, in the town of Cuernavaca, Ignacio Echeverría and José Mariano Campos have proclaimed the Plan of Cuernavaca, in which they demand to, derogate the Ley del Caso and not tolerate any Masonic influences. Declare as nule the laws emitted by the Congress of the Union and the Local Legislatures and request the protection of President Santa Anna for the plan and recognize him as the only authority. More than 100 town halls have already declared their addition to the Plan of Cuernavaca and after the members of the Chambers tried to gather, they found themselves with the keys of the salon lost and the doors closed and protected by rebel armed forces. Santa Anna replied that sessions coult not continue any longer outside the period signed in the COnstitution. Santa Anna has set his posture publishing a manifesto to the people, in which he expressed to be willing to defend the wishes of the people to keep the catholic religion unharmed and that he had 'implored' to the Chambers the derogation of some laws to clam down agitations. Soon after, Santa Anna's mask fell off and he dissolved the Capital's town hall, and announced his decision to join the Plan of Cuernavaca.
